geninfo.para: In today's environment, it's not unusual for vehicle horizontal paint surfaces to develop tiny spots as a result of industrial fallout and other environmental contaminants (rail dust, brake dust, other environmental sources of iron and steel dust, acid rain and other pollutants). Typically this is surface rust and has come from particles lying on the painted surface and may appear on either the cab or the hood. This results in oxidation that can stain the surface of the clearcoat. Upon close examination (a magnifying glass may help), a small black dot often appears in the center of the spot. This is the offending material that is causing the oxidation.

International has tested and approved the following procedure that can effectively remove this unsightly spotting. Buffing, polishing, sanding or painting prior to using this procedure may result in unsatisfactory results.

entry.para: Finish Kare No. 1119 Soil and Coating Remover
Finish Kare No. 118SC Liquid Neutralizer Concentrate Shampoo

warning.para: To prevent personal injury, wear eye protection, rubber gloves and protective clothing. Carefully follow manufacturer's recommended application procedures.

step1.para: Wash the vehicle to remove unwanted dirt and dust, and then proceed as follows:

caution.para: DO NOT allow the mixture to dry or streak down the side of the vehicle.

step2.para: Mix Finish Kare #1119 Soil and Coating Remover, 1 part of #1119 to 4 parts of COLD water. Prepare 1-2 gallons as needed.
Use a dry, clean wash mitt and apply the mixture to areas where spots have occurred. Lightly rub the surface with the mixture for 5 to 10 minutes depending upon the degree of spotting.
Make sure the vehicle is clean and dry.
Using a dry, clean wash mitt or sponge, apply Finish Kare #833 Rust Remover to the surface, one panel at a time. Do not use the same wash mitt as used in step 1.
Lightly rub the surface with the Rust Remover for 5 to 10 minutes depending upon the degree of spotting.

step1.para: Rinse the surface with a strong jet of cold water to completely remove the particles.
If the particles are not completely removed, repeat steps 1 and 2.

After the iron particles are removed, apply Finish Kare #118SC Liquid Neutralizer Concentrate Shampoo or equivalent (The Neutralizer Concentrate is a heavy-duty shampoo). This is required to neutralize the removal action.

step2.para: Mix the concentrate as 1 part concentrate to 100 parts water.
Apply the neutralizer shampoo with a clean mitt or sponge.
Rinse with clean cold water and dry vehicle.

step1.para: If fine scratches appear on the surface, use an available aftermarket light "finishing" compound with a foam pad to remove scratches.
Frequent washing and waxing can help prevent further spotting.
